HomeBanner.subtitle: Harmonization & Analysis of Sequencing & Phenotype Data

tab1.title: Speed Up Diagnosis
tab1.description: Prioritises genetic mutations in patients based on their phenotypes described using the Human Phenotype Ontology.

tab2.title: Multiple Analysis Tools
tab2.description: Exomiser, PubmedScore, Phenogenon, SimReg, Bevimed and SKAT score genetic variants and phenotypes.

tab3.title: Gene-Phenotype Relations
tab3.description: Using the gene or phenotype view, understand the spectrum of phenotypes that gene mutations lead to.

statistic.title: Phenopolis Statistics
statistic.description: Phenopolis includes data from 6,048 exomes representing a total number of 4,859,971 variants.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Please feel free to contact us <1>here</1> to give us feedback or report any issues.

LoginBox.title: Sign in
LoginBox.Hint: Click <1> Demo Login</1> to have a try!

NavSearch.NoOption: Sorry, we did not get any auto completing options...So sad.

Footer.Description: Phenopolis is a platform for harmonization and analysis of sequencing and phenotype data. Development of Phenopolis was supported by RP Fighting Blindness, NIHR (UCL-Moorfields Eyes Hospital Biomedical Research Center), the UK Medical Research Council, the British Heart Foundation and the Japan Society for the Promotion of Science.
Footer.Citation: If you use Phenopolis, please cite us as: <1>Pontikos, N. et al. (2017). Phenopolis: an open platform for harmonization and analysis of genetic and phenotypic data. Bioinformatics, 9, 7</1>
